p: Despite the public health relevance of such outbreaks, only a few mathematical models have been applied to characterize CHIKV transmission dynamics [ 6, 26]. For the 2007 outbreak, the available estimates of the basic reproductive number (R 0) were in the range of 2–2.3 with mean value 2.15 [ 27], 3.4–4.6 with mean value 4 [ 28], and 1.8–6 with mean value 3.3 [ 26]. The differences in R 0 estimates are primarily due to different modeling methodologies and parameters (e.g., vector susceptibility and/or longevity). Only one study estimated R 0 for the 2017 outbreak, resulting in the range 1.5–2.6 with mean value 2 [ 6] (see Table 1).
